title: Sky extends broadcasting deal with US network behind hit TV show Game of Thrones
text:
Sky has extended its broadcasting deal with the US network behind hit TV show Game of Thrones.

The British company, which has 24m pay-TV customers across Europe, said it would be able to continue showing programmes made by HBO owner Warner Media, such as Watchmen, Succession and Big Little Lies.

Fast forward: House of the Dragon will follow the ancestors of Daenerys Targaryen, played by Emilia Clarke (pictured), in Game of Thrones

And it is expected to cover rights for the hugely-anticipated Game of Thrones prequel series that was announced yesterday.

House of the Dragon will be set 300 years before the original show, which ended after eight seasons this year. It will follow the ancestors of Daenerys Targaryen, played by Emilia Clarke, in Game of Thrones.

HBO has not confirmed the launch date but it is expected to debut next year or in 2021, Digital Spy reported.

Sky first agreed its partnership with HBO in 2010, allowing it to bring hits such as Game of Thrones, True Detective and Succession to British screens. It is a major boost to Sky ahead of the launch of several rival streaming services from media giants Disney, Apple and HBO itself.
description: The British company said it would be able to continue showing programmes made by HBO owner Warner Media, such as Watchmen, Succession and Big Little Lies.
authors: Finance Reporter For The Daily Mail
